name: Counterfactual Reasoning
definition: The capacity of the Pilot to simulate alternative histories ('What if?') using an internal model, enabling decision-making based on imagined outcomes rather than just trial-and-error.
mechanism: Twin World Simulation: Mental Model vs. Reality.
implications: The Pilot can 'live' multiple futures before choosing one.
Trial-and-error in Reality is replaced by Simulation in Mind.
This is the basis of Intelligence (Virtual Selection).
